title: What are the ten most important principles of mathematical logic? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not sure, what you mean by writing on principles of mathematical logic. If one takes into account, for example, logic of zero-order (classical propositional calculus), then one introduces the logical variables, the logical functors: conjunction, disjunction etc., one defines also the set of all well-built formulas (language of classical propositional calculus), one also assumes that the logical formulas can take only one from two logical values: “0” or “1”, and defines also the notion of tautology (a well-built formula, which takes always logical value “1”). In such approach you can check, whether the given formula is tautology, by using zero-one method or method by contradiction (of course, you need to know the tables of truth for conjunction, disjunction etc.). Moreover, if one considers logic of zero-order (classical propositional calculus), as a system, then there are necessary: axioms and rules of inference. For example, you can write such system of logic of zero-order (classical propositional calculus), symbolically as: <R_{0+}, A>, where R_{0+} - the set of rules of inference (there are: Modus Ponens and substitution rule), A - the set of axioms of classical propositional calculus. Of course, one has also to define and operation of consequence, and now one can derive new theses of classical propositional calculus.
